freenet.clients.http
Class ToadletContextImpl

java.lang.Object
  freenet.clients.http.ToadletContextImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
ToadletContext
public class ToadletContextImpl
extends Object
implements ToadletContext

ToadletContext implementation, including all the icky HTTP parsing etc. An actual ToadletContext object represents a request, after we have parsed the headers. It provides methods to send replies.

Author:
root

sendReplyHeaders

public void sendReplyHeaders(int replyCode,
                             String replyDescription,
                             MultiValueTable<String,String> mvt,
                             String mimeType,
                             long contentLength,
                             Date mTime)
                      throws ToadletContextClosedException,
                             IOException
Description copied from interface: ToadletContext
Write reply headers.

Specified by:
sendReplyHeaders in interface ToadletContext
Parameters:
replyCode - HTTP code.
replyDescription - HTTP code description.
mvt - Any extra headers.
mimeType - The MIME type of the reply.
contentLength - The length of the reply.
mTime - The modification time of the data being sent or null for 'now' and disabling caching
Throws:
ToadletContextClosedException
IOException

writeData

               throws ToadletContextClosedException,
                      IOException
Description copied from interface: ToadletContext
Write data from a bucket. You must send reply headers first.

Specified by:
writeData in interface ToadletContext
Parameters:
data - The Bucket which contains the reply data. This function does not free() the Bucket! FIXME: For all references to this function, check whether they free() the Bucket.

ToadletContextClosedException

addFormChild

public HTMLNode addFormChild(HTMLNode parentNode,
                             String target,
                             String name)
Description copied from interface: ToadletContext
Add a form node to an HTMLNode under construction. This will have the correct enctype and formPassword set already, so all the caller needs to do is add its specific fields.

Specified by:
addFormChild in interface ToadletContext
Parameters:
parentNode - The parent HTMLNode.
target - Where the form should be POSTed to.
name - HTML name for the form for stylesheet/script access. Will be added as both id and name.
Returns:
The form HTMLNode.

forceDisconnect

public void forceDisconnect()
Description copied from interface: ToadletContext
Force a disconnection after handling this request. Used only when a throwable was thrown and we don't know what the state of the connection is. FIXME we could handle this better by remembering whether headers have been sent, how long the attached data should be, how much data has been sent etc.

Specified by:
forceDisconnect in interface ToadletContext
